events.title: Asthma Control Test
events.description: The patient underwent an asthma control test indicating that their asthma is well controlled. They reported no shortness of breath, no nighttime awakenings due to asthma symptoms, and usage of their reliever inhaler only once a week or less. This suggests effective management of their asthma condition.

events.title: Diabetes Management Medications
events.description: The patient is prescribed multiple medications for diabetes management, including Metformin 500mg taken three times a day, and Gabapentin 300mg taken three times a day. This indicates ongoing management of diabetes type II, which is critical for preventing complications associated with the condition.

events.title: Diabetes Type II Review
events.description: A comprehensive review for diabetes type II was conducted, with multiple pathology tests requested including Haemoglobin A1c and Creatinine & Electrolytes Profile. These tests are essential for monitoring the patient's diabetes control and kidney function, which are vital in preventing long-term complications.

events.title: Diabetic Foot Risk Assessment
events.description: The patient was assessed for diabetic foot risk, revealing that the left dorsalis pedis pulse is absent and the left posterior tibial pulse is also absent, indicating a significant risk for diabetic foot complications. The right diabetic foot is at moderate risk, necessitating close monitoring and preventive care.

events.title: Medication for Chronic Conditions
events.description: The patient is on a regimen that includes Atorvastatin 40mg, Clopidogrel 75mg, and Lansoprazole 15mg, among others. This combination suggests management of cardiovascular risk factors and gastrointestinal protection, which are important for patients with chronic conditions.

events.title: Medication for Cognitive Function
events.description: The patient was prescribed Memantine 10mg, indicating management of cognitive decline, possibly related to dementia or Alzheimer's disease. This is significant for maintaining cognitive function in the patient.
